body:
no, there wasn't any warning on the first step.

```
php -i | grep curl
configure command =>  './configure'  '--build=x86_64-redhat-linux-gnu' '--host=x86_64-redhat-linux-gnu' '--target=x86_64-redhat-linux-gnu' '--program-prefix=' '--prefix=/usr' '--exec-prefix=/usr' php warning:  unknown: it is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. you are *required* to use the date.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. in case you used any of those methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier. we selected 'europe/berlin' for 'cet/1.0/no dst' instead in unknown on line 0
```

i get the exact same error, when installing from the web with the setup-owncloud.php script.  dependency check says "all dependencies found", then the next step gives the same error: 

![screenshot - 1_28_2013 10_56_30 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3414035/106124/9be021ba-69e1-11e2-9032-79740e372373.jpg)

although, i don't get the additional info about the owncloud.org ssl cert failure.   

result of php -i | grep curl are as follows:

 php -i | grep curl
configure command =>  './configure'  '--disable-cgi' '--enable-bcmath' '--enable-calendar' '--enable-dbase' '--enable-exif' '--enable-fastcgi' '--enable-ftp' '--enable-gd-native-ttf' '--enable-libxml' '--enable-magic-quotes' '--enable-mbstring' '--enable-pdo=shared' '--enable-soap' '--enable-sockets' '--enable-wddx' '--enable-zend-multibyte' '--enable-zip' '--prefix=/usr/local' '--with-bz2' '--with-curl=/opt/curlssl/' '--with-curlwrappers' '--with-freetype-dir=/usr' '--with-gd' '--with-gettext' '--with-imap=/opt/php_with_imap_client/' '--with-imap-ssl=/usr' '--with-jpeg-dir=/usr' '--with-kerberos' '--with-libdir=lib64' '--with-libexpat-dir=/usr' '--with-libxml-dir=/opt/xml2' '--with-libxml-dir=/opt/xml2/' '--with-mcrypt=/opt/libmcrypt/' '--with-mhash=/opt/mhash/' '--with-mime-magic' '--with-mysql=/usr' '--with-mysql-sock=/var/lib/mysql/mysql.sock' '--with-mysqli=/usr/bin/mysql_config' '--with-openssl=/usr' '--with-openssl-dir=/usr' '--with-pcre-regex=/opt/pcre' '--with-pdo-mysql=shared' '--with-pdo-sqlite=shared' '--with-pgsql=/usr' '--with-pic' '--with-png-dir=/usr' '--with-pspell' '--with-sqlite=shared' '--with-tidy=/opt/tidy/' '--with-ttf' '--with-xmlrpc' '--with-xpm-dir=/usr' '--with-xsl=/opt/xslt/' '--with-zlib' '--with-zlib-dir=/usr'
curl
curl information => libcurl/7.24.0 openssl/0.9.8b zlib/1.2.3 libidn/0.6.5


please advise.  the web install worked great several months ago when i tested on my same server.  i had since deleted the install, but needed it again, so i installed the latest version, only to run into this.

>â  you can disable ssl cert verification by removing https://github.com/owncloud/administration/blob/master/web-installer/setup-owncloud.php#l121
    
    thanks, but actually you have to set the option to false (it
    apparently defaults to true), as follows:	curl_setopt($ch, curlopt_ssl_verifypeer, false);
    
    thanks!â  it did install ok.on 1/28/2013 11:59 pm, thomas mã¼ller
      wrote:
    
      looks like the ssl cert for download.owncloud.com can not fully
        be verified.@karlitschek any changes on the
        servers recently?
      @gh-user
        you can disable ssl cert verification by removing https://github.com/owncloud/administration/blob/master/web-installer/setup-owncloud.php#l121
      
        â€”
        reply to this email directly or view
          it on github.

there are two different versions of "setup-owncloud.php". this:
https://download.owncloud.com/download/community/setup-owncloud.php
is not the same as this:
https://github.com/owncloud/administration/blob/master/web-installer/setup-owncloud.php

what is the newer version?

> you can disable ssl cert verification by removing https://github.com/owncloud/administration/blob/master/web-installer/setup-owncloud.php#l121

> thanks, but actually you have to set the option to false (it apparently defaults to true), as follows: curl_setopt($ch, curlopt_ssl_verifypeer, false);

both did not help. i'm getting still the same error and:

> notice: use of undefined constant curlopt_certinfo - assumed 'curlopt_certinfo' in /home/domain.de/domains/owncloud.domain.de/public_html/setup-owncloud.php on line 120 

> warning: curl_setopt() expects parameter 2 to be long, string given in /home/domain.de/domains/owncloud.domain.de/public_html/setup-owncloud.php on line 120 

> warning: rename(tmp-owncloud1359452088/owncloud,./owncloud): no such file or directory in /home/domain.de/domains/owncloud.domain.de/public_html/setup-owncloud.php on line 92

curlopt_certinfo is only available from php 5.3.2 on.
which php version do you have installed?
he. it seems that we have a miss-configuration or our ssl server. sorry for that. we will look into that as soon as possible.

hi @gh-user. i tested this further. it's really strange. all the curl version that i have accept the ssl cert and everything works. i don't know why your curl has a problem with our ssl cert. i recommend to install owncloud manually in this case by downloading the tar file and unpacking it manually.
i waited for the owncloud version 5 and now the installation worked without any issues.
